resources.string:
Note: Please scroll down for full content.

BusyBox combines tiny versions of many common UNIX utilities into a single small executable. It provides replacements for most of the utilities you usually find in GNU fileutils, shellutils, etc The utilities in BusyBox generally have fewer options than their full-featured GNU cousins; however, the options that are included provide the expected functionality and behave very much like their GNU counterparts. BusyBox provides a fairly complete environment for any small or embedded system.

BusyBox has been written with size-optimization and limited resources in mind. It is also extremely modular so you can easily include or exclude commands (or features) at compile time. This makes it easy to customize your embedded systems. To create a working system, just add some device nodes in /dev, a few configuration files in /etc, and a Linux kernel.

BusyBox is maintained by Denys Vlasenko, and licensed under the GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE version 2.



To be clear, we EXA LAB are not author of Busybox, we only compile the binary statically with cross compiler without any modification to source.

You can find the binary, .config file for compiling, and the source code of this app by clicking the button below, clicking the button will open a url in the browser which will be redirect to your requested content.
Please press again to exit application

Busybox Version : 1.30.0

Busybox Installer (no root) is an app designed to bring busybox to android device without root access.

Thanks for using this apps.


Regards, EXA Lab

Note: Please scroll down to see all steps if your device screen is small.

Method 1 is recommended because not only easy to update, also make all terminal accessible to busybox. But if method 1 is not working, please try using method 2 instead.

Step 1 : Click on the button to install Busybox
Step 2 : Copy the command to clipboard : \n\nexport PATH=/data/data/exa.free.bbin/files/:$PATH
Launch terminal, paste and enter the command and you can start busybox. You must paste and enter the command every time you restart the terminal.
Note: Please scroll down to see all steps if your device screen is small.\n\nStep 1 : Click on the button to Copy Busybox
Note: Please scroll down to see all steps if your device screen is small.\n\nStep 1 : Please choose a Terminal Emulator App.

Step 4: Launch terminal, paste and enter the command to install Busybox. You can then run Busybox with ./busybox command.\n\nIMPORTANT: You must paste and enter the command IN STEP 5 next time after you restart the terminal.
